intro: Stachytarpheta belizensis, commonly known as the Belize stachytarpheta, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It is often found in regions with high humidity and well-drained soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
